array.string: This is a tip. A tip will show up when you start the app unless you turn it off in the settings menu.
A quick way to switch between training and listening modes is by pinching. Pinch out for listening mode and in for training.
Think you mastered all the intervals? Try switching up the playmodes for a new challenge.
If you think the intervals are playing too slow or too fast you can change the tempo in the settings menu.
Changing the root and high octaves in settings will set a range of octaves that intervals can be played in.
Want to stay in one octave while training? You can set the low and high octaves to both be C3 or C4. This will keep you in one octave.
If you are new to intervals we recommend you start on beginner difficulty. As you train you can work your way up to pro.
Want to know how well you are doing? Scroll up to view stats for your current session.
If you are having a hard time guessing the intervals try listening mode. Tap any interval in this mode to hear how it sounds.
Has this app improved your ability to recognize intervals or chords? If so why not give us a good rating or share it with your friends.

dict.string: This is a tip. A tip will show up when you start the app unless you turn it off in the settings menu.
A quick way to switch between training and listening modes is by pinching. Pinch out for listening mode and in for training.
Think you mastered all the intervals? Try switching up the playmodes for a new challenge.
If you think the intervals are playing too slow or too fast you can change the tempo in the settings menu.
Changing the root and high octaves in settings will set a range of octaves that intervals can be played in.
Want to stay in one octave while training? You can set the low and high octaves to both be C3 or C4. This will keep you in one octave.
If you are new to intervals we recommend you start on beginner difficulty. As you train you can work your way up to pro.
Want to know how well you are doing? Scroll up to view stats for your current session.
If you are having a hard time guessing the intervals try listening mode. Tap any interval in this mode to hear how it sounds.
Has this app improved your ability to recognize intervals or chords? If so why not give us a good rating or share it with your friends.
Try listening mode to get a good idea of how each interval sounds and how an interval sounds compared to other intervals.
